title: Cider no You ni Kotoba ga Wakiagaru
title_english: Words Bubble Up Like Soda Pop
title_japanese: サイダーのように言葉が湧き上がる
synopsis: The visual features the tagline, "I met you in my 17th summer ..." The "boy-meets-girl" story depicts how words and music bridge the gap between Cherry, a boy who is terrible at communicating with other people, and Smile, a girl who hides behind a mask. They meet in a mundane suburban shopping mall in a provincial city. Cherry always wears headphones and puts the feelings he cannot utter into his hobby, Japanese haiku poems. Smile always wears a mask to conceal her large front teeth, for which she has dental braces. As a popular video star, she streams a video about seeking "cuteness." (Source: ANN)
ending_themes: "Cider no You ni Kotoba ga Wakiagaru" by never young beach
